page.title: 03Westbury Parish Hall
page.content: The Parish Hall is the 'hub' of the community and is used by young and old, Brownies, Guides, Cubs, Scouts, Playgroup, Youth Club, Women's Institute, Age Concern to name but a few. It is booked every night in the week. The surrounding Playing Fields are used regularly by the Cricket and Football Clubs and many of the other groups have their own sports days. Annually, there is a Mini-Marathon which attracts people from all over the County. The hall is also used for markets, jumble sales, dances, the annual flower and vegetable show, whist drives, etc. The Youth Club put on an annual pantomime or review. Many of these events raise a considerable amount of money for local charities.
